Description: Fragment of flattened handle of a pottery transport amphora at neck join. Clay near fine buff-brown; much small mica. Rectangular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Erasios (otherwise unattested). The name is found on an unpublished stamp in the Benaki collection, Alexandria Museum and on several from the Athenian Agora (SS529, 3785, 11082 etc) all from the same or similar dies; contexts there give the approximate date. Trimmed.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1574)
